title: Observations on the Psychiatric Section of the International Classification of Diseases and the British Glossary of Mental Disorders
abstract: SUMMARY Problems arising from the categories used in the Eighth Revision of the International Classification of Diseases , and from some of the definitions included in the British Glossary , are discussed. Suggestions are made for changes which would facilitate the use of the I.C.D. , firstly for furnishing quantitative data to answer questions about groups of cases, and secondly for retrieval of information about patients with particular syndromes for purposes of research studies. Finally, a multi-axial system for diagnostic coding is described.
